text: date: wed, 15 dec 1999 18:40:35 -0700 from: "judy f bowles" (judyxke@earthlink.net)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: brain differences in female/malewith regard to "why men see things differently," 14.dec.1999. obviously, johns hopkins researchers need to throw out their preconceived prejudice and start over with people capable of looking at the lack of any evidence before making a sweeping generalization. this is the same chauvinist garbage as "men are the only ones who can fly fighter jets because of spatial and response time ability." oh, and of course, they have found evidence that can naturally be attributed to "emotion" in women.go back to the drawing board boys. and go back with minds devoid of garbage. try looking at more than 15 people, as well. look at the brain first, and do not show the researcher which brain was female/male, so they can't go in with their garbage up front.i certainly hope this garbage was not espoused with the support of any of my tax dollars.
